21/*! \file bm.h
22 \brief Compressed bit-vector bvector<> container, set algebraic methods, traversal iterators
23*/

26// define BM_NO_STL if you use BM in "STL free" environment and want
27// to disable any references to STL headers
28#ifndef BM_NO_STL
29# include <iterator>
30# include <initializer_list>
31# include <stdexcept>
32#endif
33
34#include <limits.h>
35
36#ifdef _MSC_VER
37#pragma warning( push )
38#pragma warning( disable : 4311 4312 4127)
39#endif

42#include "bmdef.h"
43#include "bmconst.h"
44#include "bmsimd.h"
45#include "bmfwd.h"

58extern "C"
59{
60#ifdef BM64ADDR
61 typedef int (*bit_visitor_callback_type)(void* handle_ptr, bm::id64_t bit_idx);
62#else
63 /**
64 Callback type to visit (callback style) bits in bit-vector(s)
65
66 @param handle_ptr - custom pointer to callback specific data
67 @param bit_idx - number/index of visited bit
68 @return negative return code is recognised as a request to interrupt visiting
69
70 @ingroup bvector
71 */
72 typedef int (*bit_visitor_callback_type)(void* handle_ptr, bm::id_t bit_idx);
73#endif
74}

77namespace bm
78{
79
80/** @defgroup bmagic BitMagic Library
81 BitMagic C++ Library
82 For more information please visit: http://bitmagic.io
83*/

85
86/** @defgroup bvector bvector<> container
87 The Main bvector<> Group
88 bvector<> template: front end of the BitMagic library.
89
90 @ingroup bmagic
91*/
92
93/** @defgroup bvit bvector<> iterators
94 Iterators for compressed bit-vector traversal
95 @ingroup bvector
96*/
97
98
99
100#ifdef BM64ADDR
101 typedef bm::id64_t bvector_size_type;
102#else
103 typedef bm::id_t bvector_size_type;
104#endif
105
106
107/*!
108 @brief Bitvector
109 Bit-vector container with runtime compression of bits
110
111 @ingroup bvector
112*/
113template<class Alloc>
114class bvector
115{
116public:
117 typedef Alloc allocator_type;
118 typedef typename allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
119 typedef blocks_manager<Alloc> blocks_manager_type;
120 typedef typename blocks_manager_type::block_idx_type block_idx_type;
121 typedef bvector_size_type size_type;
122
123 /** Statistical information about bitset's memory allocation details. */
124 struct statistics : public bv_statistics
125 {};
126
127 /*!
128 \brief Optimization mode
129 Every next level means additional checks (better compression vs time)
130 \sa optimize
131 */
132 enum optmode
133 {
134 opt_none = 0, ///< no optimization
135 opt_free_0 = 1, ///< Free unused 0 blocks
136 opt_free_01 = 2, ///< Free unused 0 and 1 blocks
137 opt_compress = 3 ///< compress blocks when possible (GAP/prefix sum)
138 };
139
140
141 /**
142 @brief Class reference implements an object for bit assignment.
143 Since C++ does not provide with build-in bit type supporting l-value
144 operations we have to emulate it.
145
146 @ingroup bvector
147 */
148 class reference
149 {
150 public:
151 reference(bvector<Alloc>& bv, size_type position) BMNOEXCEPT
152 : bv_(bv),
153 position_(position)
154 {}
155
156 reference(const reference& ref) BMNOEXCEPT
157 : bv_(ref.bv_),
158 position_(ref.position_)
159 {
160 bv_.set(position_, ref.bv_.get_bit(position_));
161 }
162
163 operator bool() const BMNOEXCEPT
164 {
165 return bv_.get_bit(position_);
166 }
167
168 const reference& operator=(const reference& ref) const
169 {
170 bv_.set(position_, (bool)ref);
171 return *this;
172 }
173
174 const reference& operator=(bool value) const BMNOEXCEPT
175 {
176 bv_.set(position_, value);
177 return *this;
178 }
179
180 bool operator==(const reference& ref) const BMNOEXCEPT
181 {
182 return bool(*this) == bool(ref);
183 }
184
185 /*! Bitwise AND. Performs operation: bit = bit AND value */
186 const reference& operator&=(bool value) const
187 {
188 bv_.set_bit_and(position_, value);
189 return *this;
190 }
191
192 /*! Bitwise OR. Performs operation: bit = bit OR value */
193 const reference& operator|=(bool value) const
194 {
195 if (value != bv_.get_bit(position_))
196 {
197 bv_.set_bit(position_);
198 }
199 return *this;
200 }
201
202 /*! Bitwise exclusive-OR (XOR). Performs operation: bit = bit XOR value */
203 const reference& operator^=(bool value) const
204 {
205 bv_.set(position_, value != bv_.get_bit(position_));
206 return *this;
207 }
208
209 /*! Logical Not operator */
210 bool operator!() const BMNOEXCEPT
211 {
212 return !bv_.get_bit(position_);
213 }
214
215 /*! Bit Not operator */
216 bool operator~() const BMNOEXCEPT
217 {
218 return !bv_.get_bit(position_);
219 }
220
221 /*! Negates the bit value */
222 reference& flip()
223 {
224 bv_.flip(position_);
225 return *this;
226 }
227
228 private:
229 bvector<Alloc>& bv_; //!< Reference variable on the parent.
230 size_type position_; //!< Position in the parent bitvector.
231 };
232
233 typedef bool const_reference;
234
235 /*!
236 @brief Base class for all iterators.
237 @ingroup bvit
238 */
239 class iterator_base
240 {
241 friend class bvector;
242 public:
243 iterator_base() BMNOEXCEPT
244 : bv_(0), position_(bm::id_max), block_(0), block_type_(0),
245 block_idx_(0)
246 {}
247
248 bool operator==(const iterator_base& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
249 {
250 return (position_ == it.position_) && (bv_ == it.bv_);
251 }
252
253 bool operator!=(const iterator_base& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
254 {
255 return ! operator==(it);
256 }
257
258 bool operator < (const iterator_base& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
259 {
260 return position_ < it.position_;
261 }
262
263 bool operator <= (const iterator_base& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
264 {
265 return position_ <= it.position_;
266 }
267
268 bool operator > (const iterator_base& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
269 {
270 return position_ > it.position_;
271 }
272
273 bool operator >= (const iterator_base& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
274 {
275 return position_ >= it.position_;
276 }
277
278 /**
279 \fn bool bm::bvector::iterator_base::valid() const
280 \brief Checks if iterator is still valid. Analog of != 0 comparison for pointers.
281 \returns true if iterator is valid.
282 */
283 bool valid() const BMNOEXCEPT { return position_ != bm::id_max; }
284
285 /**
286 \fn bool bm::bvector::iterator_base::invalidate()
287 \brief Turns iterator into an invalid state.
288 */
289 void invalidate() BMNOEXCEPT
290 { position_ = bm::id_max; block_type_ = ~0u;}
291
292 /** \brief Compare FSMs for testing purposes
293 \internal
294 */
295 bool compare_state(const iterator_base& ib) const BMNOEXCEPT
296 {
297 if (this->bv_ != ib.bv_) return false;
298 if (this->position_ != ib.position_) return false;
299 if (this->block_ != ib.block_) return false;
300 if (this->block_type_ != ib.block_type_) return false;
301 if (this->block_idx_ != ib.block_idx_) return false;
302
303 const block_descr& bd = this->bdescr_;
304 const block_descr& ib_db = ib.bdescr_;
305
306 if (this->block_type_ == 0) // bit block
307 {
308 if (bd.bit_.ptr != ib_db.bit_.ptr) return false;
309 if (bd.bit_.idx != ib_db.bit_.idx) return false;
310 if (bd.bit_.cnt != ib_db.bit_.cnt) return false;
311 if (bd.bit_.pos != ib_db.bit_.pos) return false;
312 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bd.bit_.cnt; ++i)
313 {
314 if (bd.bit_.bits[i] != ib_db.bit_.bits[i]) return false;
315 }
316 }
317 else // GAP block
318 {
319 if (bd.gap_.ptr != ib_db.gap_.ptr) return false;
320 if (bd.gap_.gap_len != ib_db.gap_.gap_len) return false;
321 }
322 return true;
323 }
324
325 public:
326
327 /** Bit-block descriptor
328 @internal
329 */
330 struct bitblock_descr
331 {
332 const bm::word_t* ptr; //!< Word pointer.
333 unsigned char bits[set_bitscan_wave_size*32]; //!< bit list
334 unsigned short idx; //!< Current position in the bit list
335 unsigned short cnt; //!< Number of ON bits
336 size_type pos; //!< Last bit position decode before
337 };
338
339 /** Information about current DGAP block.
340 @internal
341 */
342 struct dgap_descr
343 {
344 const gap_word_t* ptr; //!< Word pointer.
345 gap_word_t gap_len; //!< Current dgap length.
346 };
347
348 protected:
349 bm::bvector<Alloc>* bv_; //!< Pointer on parent bitvector
350 size_type position_; //!< Bit position (bit idx)
351 const bm::word_t* block_; //!< Block pointer.(NULL-invalid)
352 unsigned block_type_; //!< Type of block. 0-Bit, 1-GAP
353 block_idx_type block_idx_; //!< Block index
354
355 /*! Block type dependent information for current block. */
356 union block_descr
357 {
358 bitblock_descr bit_; //!< BitBlock related info.
359 dgap_descr gap_; //!< DGAP block related info.
360 } bdescr_;
361 };
362
363 /*!
364 @brief Output iterator iterator designed to set "ON" bits based on
365 input sequence of integers (bit indeces).
366
367 STL container can be converted to bvector using this iterator
368 Insert iterator guarantees the vector will be dynamically resized
369 (set_bit does not do that).
370
371 @note
372 If you have many bits to set it is a good idea to use output iterator
373 instead of explicitly calling set, because iterator may implement
374 some performance specific tricks to make sure bulk insert is fast.
375
376 @sa bulk_insert_iterator
377
378 @ingroup bvit
379 */
380 class insert_iterator
381 {
382 friend class bulk_insert_iterator;
383 public:
384#ifndef BM_NO_STL
385 typedef std::output_iterator_tag iterator_category;
386#endif
387 typedef bm::bvector<Alloc> bvector_type;
388 typedef size_type value_type;
389 typedef void difference_type;
390 typedef void pointer;
391 typedef void reference;
392
393 insert_iterator() BMNOEXCEPT : bvect_(0), max_bit_(0) {}
394
395 insert_iterator(bvector<Alloc>& bvect) BMNOEXCEPT
396 : bvect_(&bvect),
397 max_bit_(bvect.size())
398 {
399 bvect_->init();
400 }
401
402 insert_iterator(const insert_iterator& iit)
403 : bvect_(iit.bvect_),
404 max_bit_(iit.max_bit_)
405 {
406 }
407
408 insert_iterator& operator=(const insert_iterator& ii)
409 {
410 bvect_ = ii.bvect_; max_bit_ = ii.max_bit_;
411 return *this;
412 }
413
414 insert_iterator& operator=(size_type n)
415 {
416 BM_ASSERT(n < bm::id_max);
417 BM_ASSERT_THROW(n < bm::id_max, BM_ERR_RANGE);
418
419 if (n >= max_bit_)
420 {
421 max_bit_ = n;
422 if (n >= bvect_->size())
423 {
424 size_type new_size = (n == bm::id_max) ? bm::id_max : n + 1;
425 bvect_->resize(new_size);
426 }
427 }
428 bvect_->set_bit_no_check(n);
429 return *this;
430 }
431 /*! Returns *this without doing anything (no-op) */
432 insert_iterator& operator*() { return *this; }
433 /*! Returns *this. This iterator does not move (no-op) */
434 insert_iterator& operator++() { return *this; }
435 /*! Returns *this. This iterator does not move (no-op)*/
436 insert_iterator& operator++(int) { return *this; }
437
438 bvector_type* get_bvector() const { return bvect_; }
439
440 protected:
441 bvector_type* bvect_;
442 size_type max_bit_;
443 };
444
445
446 /*!
447 @brief Output iterator iterator designed to set "ON" bits based on
448 input sequence of integers.
449
450 STL container can be converted to bvector using this iterator
451 Insert iterator guarantees the vector will be dynamically resized
452 (set_bit does not do that).
453
454 The difference from the canonical insert iterator, is that
455 bulk insert implements internal buffering, which needs
456 to flushed (or flushed automatically when goes out of scope).
457 Buffering creates a delayed effect, which needs to be
458 taken into account.
459
460 @sa insert_iterator
461
462 @ingroup bvit
463 */
464 class bulk_insert_iterator
465 {
466 public:
467#ifndef BM_NO_STL
468 typedef std::output_iterator_tag iterator_category;
469#endif
470 typedef bm::bvector<Alloc> bvector_type;
471 typedef bvector_type::size_type size_type;
472 typedef bvector_type::size_type value_type;
473 typedef void difference_type;
474 typedef void pointer;
475 typedef void reference;
476
477 bulk_insert_iterator() BMNOEXCEPT
478 : bvect_(0), buf_(0), buf_size_(0), sorted_(BM_UNKNOWN) {}
479
480 ~bulk_insert_iterator()
481 {
482 flush();
483 if (buf_)
484 bvect_->blockman_.get_allocator().free_bit_block((bm::word_t*)buf_);
485 }
486
487 bulk_insert_iterator(bvector<Alloc>& bvect,
488 bm::sort_order so = BM_UNKNOWN) BMNOEXCEPT
489 : bvect_(&bvect), sorted_(so)
490 {
491 bvect_->init();
492
493 buf_ = (value_type*) bvect_->blockman_.get_allocator().alloc_bit_block();
494 buf_size_ = 0;
495 }
496
497 bulk_insert_iterator(const bulk_insert_iterator& iit)
498 : bvect_(iit.bvect_)
499 {
500 buf_ = bvect_->blockman_.get_allocator().alloc_bit_block();
501 buf_size_ = iit.buf_size_;
502 sorted_ = iit.sorted_;
503 ::memcpy(buf_, iit.buf_, buf_size_ * sizeof(*buf_));
504 }
505
506 bulk_insert_iterator(const insert_iterator& iit)
507 : bvect_(iit.get_bvector())
508 {
509 buf_ = (value_type*) bvect_->blockman_.get_allocator().alloc_bit_block();
510 buf_size_ = 0;
511 sorted_ = BM_UNKNOWN;
512 }
513
514 bulk_insert_iterator(bulk_insert_iterator&& iit) BMNOEXCEPT
515 : bvect_(iit.bvect_)
516 {
517 buf_ = iit.buf_; iit.buf_ = 0;
518 buf_size_ = iit.buf_size_;
519 sorted_ = iit.sorted_;
520 }
521
522 bulk_insert_iterator& operator=(const bulk_insert_iterator& ii)
523 {
524 bvect_ = ii.bvect_;
525 if (!buf_)
526 buf_ = bvect_->allocate_tempblock();
527 buf_size_ = ii.buf_size_;
528 ::memcpy(buf_, ii.buf_, buf_size_ * sizeof(*buf_));
529 sorted_ = ii.sorted_;
530 return *this;
531 }
532
533 bulk_insert_iterator& operator=(bulk_insert_iterator&& ii) BMNOEXCEPT
534 {
535 bvect_ = ii.bvect_;
536 if (buf_)
537 bvect_->free_tempblock(buf_);
538 buf_ = ii.buf_; ii.buf_ = 0;
539 buf_size_ = ii.buf_size_;
540 sorted_ = ii.sorted_;
541 return *this;
542 }
543
544 bulk_insert_iterator& operator=(size_type n)
545 {
546 BM_ASSERT(n < bm::id_max);
547 BM_ASSERT_THROW(n < bm::id_max, BM_ERR_RANGE);
548
549 if (buf_size_ == buf_size_max())
550 {
551 bvect_->import(buf_, buf_size_, sorted_);
552 buf_size_ = 0;
553 }
554 buf_[buf_size_++] = n;
555 return *this;
556 }
557
558 /*! Returns *this without doing anything (no-op) */
559 bulk_insert_iterator& operator*() { return *this; }
560 /*! Returns *this. This iterator does not move (no-op) */
561 bulk_insert_iterator& operator++() { return *this; }
562 /*! Returns *this. This iterator does not move (no-op)*/
563 bulk_insert_iterator& operator++(int) { return *this; }
564
565 /*! Flush the internal buffer into target bvector */
566 void flush()
567 {
568 BM_ASSERT(bvect_);
569 if (buf_size_)
570 {
571 bvect_->import(buf_, buf_size_, sorted_);
572 buf_size_ = 0;
573 }
574 bvect_->sync_size();
575 }
576
577 bvector_type* get_bvector() const BMNOEXCEPT { return bvect_; }
578
579 protected:
580 static
581 size_type buf_size_max() BMNOEXCEPT
582 {
583 #ifdef BM64ADDR
584 return bm::set_block_size / 2;
585 #else
586 return bm::set_block_size;
587 #endif
588 }
589
590 protected:
591 bvector_type* bvect_; ///< target bvector
592 size_type* buf_; ///< bulk insert buffer
593 size_type buf_size_; ///< current buffer size
594 bm::sort_order sorted_; ///< sort order hint
595 };
596
597
598
599 /*! @brief Constant iterator designed to enumerate "ON" bits
600 @ingroup bvit
601 */
602 class enumerator : public iterator_base
603 {
604 public:
605#ifndef BM_NO_STL
606 typedef std::input_iterator_tag iterator_category;
607#endif
608 typedef size_type value_type;
609 typedef unsigned difference_type;
610 typedef unsigned* pointer;
611 typedef unsigned& reference;
612
613 public:
614 enumerator() BMNOEXCEPT : iterator_base()
615 {}
616
617 /*! @brief Construct enumerator associated with a vector.
618 Important: This construction creates unpositioned iterator with status
619 valid() == false. It can be re-positioned using go_first() or go_to().
620 @sa go_to
621 */
622 enumerator(const bvector<Alloc>* bv) BMNOEXCEPT
623 : iterator_base()
624 {
625 this->bv_ = const_cast<bvector<Alloc>*>(bv);
626 }
627
628 /*! @brief Construct enumerator for bit vector
629 @param bv bit-vector reference
630 @param pos bit position in the vector
631 if position is 0, it finds the next 1 or becomes not valid
632 (en.valid() == false)
633 */
634 enumerator(const bvector<Alloc>& bv, size_type pos = 0) BMNOEXCEPT
635 : iterator_base()
636 {
637 this->bv_ = const_cast<bvector<Alloc>*>(&bv);
638 go_to(pos);
639 }
640
641
642 /*! @brief Construct enumerator for bit vector
643 @param bv bit-vector pointer
644 @param pos bit position in the vector
645 if position is 0, it finds the next 1 or becomes not valid
646 (en.valid() == false)
647 */
648 enumerator(const bvector<Alloc>* bv, size_type pos) BMNOEXCEPT
649 : iterator_base()
650 {
651 this->bv_ = const_cast<bvector<Alloc>*>(bv);
652 this->go_to(pos);
653 }
654
655 /*! \brief Get current position (value) */
656 size_type operator*() const BMNOEXCEPT { return this->position_; }
657
658 /*! \brief Get current position (value) */
659 size_type value() const BMNOEXCEPT { return this->position_; }
660
661 /*! \brief Advance enumerator forward to the next available bit */
662 enumerator& operator++() BMNOEXCEPT { this->go_up(); return *this; }
663
664 /*! \brief Advance enumerator forward to the next available bit.
665 Possibly do NOT use this operator it is slower than the pre-fix increment.
666 */
667 enumerator operator++(int) BMNOEXCEPT
668 {
669 enumerator tmp = *this;
670 this->go_up();
671 return tmp;
672 }
673
674 /*! \brief Position enumerator to the first available bit */
675 void go_first() BMNOEXCEPT;
676
677 /*! advance iterator forward by one
678 @return true if advance was successfull and the enumerator is valid
679 */
680 bool advance() BMNOEXCEPT { return this->go_up(); }
681
682 /*! \brief Advance enumerator to the next available bit */
683 bool go_up() BMNOEXCEPT;
684
685 /*!
686 @brief Skip to specified relative rank
687 @param rank - number of ON bits to go for (must be: > 0)
688 @return true if skip was successfull and enumerator is valid
689 */
690 bool skip_to_rank(size_type rank) BMNOEXCEPT
691 {
692 BM_ASSERT(rank);
693 --rank;
694 if (!rank)
695 return this->valid();
696 return skip(rank);
697 }
698
699 /*!
700 @brief Skip specified number of bits from enumeration
701 @param rank - number of ON bits to skip
702 @return true if skip was successfull and enumerator is valid
703 */
704 bool skip(size_type rank) BMNOEXCEPT;
705
706 /*!
707 @brief go to a specific position in the bit-vector (or next)
708 */
709 bool go_to(size_type pos) BMNOEXCEPT;
710
711 private:
712 typedef typename iterator_base::block_descr block_descr_type;
713
714 static bool decode_wave(block_descr_type* bdescr) BMNOEXCEPT;
715 bool decode_bit_group(block_descr_type* bdescr) BMNOEXCEPT;
716 bool decode_bit_group(block_descr_type* bdescr,
717 size_type& rank) BMNOEXCEPT;
718 bool search_in_bitblock() BMNOEXCEPT;
719 bool search_in_gapblock() BMNOEXCEPT;
720 bool search_in_blocks() BMNOEXCEPT;
721
722 };
723
724 /*!
725 @brief Constant iterator designed to enumerate "ON" bits
726 counted_enumerator keeps bitcount, ie number of ON bits starting
727 from the position 0 in the bit string up to the currently enumerated bit
728
729 When increment operator called current position is increased by 1.
730
731 @ingroup bvit
732 */
733 class counted_enumerator : public enumerator
734 {
735 public:
736#ifndef BM_NO_STL
737 typedef std::input_iterator_tag iterator_category;
738#endif
739 counted_enumerator() BMNOEXCEPT : bit_count_(0){}
740
741 counted_enumerator(const enumerator& en) BMNOEXCEPT : enumerator(en)
742 {
743 bit_count_ = this->valid(); // 0 || 1
744 }
745
746 counted_enumerator& operator=(const enumerator& en) BMNOEXCEPT
747 {
748 enumerator* me = this;
749 *me = en;
750 if (this->valid())
751 this->bit_count_ = 1;
752 return *this;
753 }
754
755 counted_enumerator& operator++() BMNOEXCEPT
756 {
757 this->go_up();
758 this->bit_count_ += this->valid();
759 return *this;
760 }
761
762 counted_enumerator operator++(int)
763 {
764 counted_enumerator tmp(*this);
765 this->go_up();
766 this->bit_count_ += this->valid();
767 return tmp;
768 }
769
770 /*! @brief Number of bits ON starting from the .
771
772 Method returns number of ON bits fromn the bit 0 to the current bit
773 For the first bit in bitvector it is 1, for the second 2
774 */
775 size_type count() const BMNOEXCEPT { return bit_count_; }
776 private:
777 /*! Function closed for usage */
778 counted_enumerator& go_to(size_type pos);
779
780 private:
781 size_type bit_count_;
782 };
783
784 /*!
785 Resource guard for bvector<>::set_allocator_pool()
786 @ingroup bvector
787 @internal
788 */
789 class mem_pool_guard
790 {
791 public:
792 mem_pool_guard() BMNOEXCEPT : bv_(0)
793 {}
794
795 mem_pool_guard(allocator_pool_type& pool, bvector<Alloc>& bv) BMNOEXCEPT
796 : bv_(&bv)
797 {
798 bv.set_allocator_pool(&pool);
799 }
800 ~mem_pool_guard()
801 {
802 if (bv_)
803 bv_->set_allocator_pool(0);
804 }
805
806 /// check if vector has no assigned allocator and set one
807 void assign_if_not_set(allocator_pool_type& pool,
808 bvector<Alloc>& bv) BMNOEXCEPT
809 {
810 if (!bv.get_allocator_pool()) // alloc pool not set yet
811 {
812 BM_ASSERT(!bv_);
813 bv_ = &bv;
814 bv_->set_allocator_pool(&pool);
815 }
816 }
817
818 private:
819 mem_pool_guard(const mem_pool_guard&) = delete;
820 void operator=(const mem_pool_guard&) = delete;
821 private:
822 bvector<Alloc>* bv_; ///< garded object
823 };
824
825
826 friend class iterator_base;
827 friend class enumerator;
828 template<class BV> friend class aggregator;
829 template<class BV> friend class operation_deserializer;
830 template<class BV, class DEC> friend class deserializer;
831
832public:
833 /*! @brief memory allocation policy
834
835 Defualt memory allocation policy uses BM_BIT, and standard
836 GAP levels tune-ups
837 */
838 struct allocation_policy
839 {
840 bm::strategy strat;
841 const gap_word_t* glevel_len;
842
843 allocation_policy(bm::strategy s=BM_BIT,
844 const gap_word_t* glevels = bm::gap_len_table<true>::_len) BMNOEXCEPT
845 : strat(s), glevel_len(glevels)
846 {}
847 };
848
849 typedef rs_index<allocator_type> blocks_count;
850 typedef rs_index<allocator_type> rs_index_type;
851
852public:
853 /*! @name Construction, initialization, assignment */
854 //@{
855
856 /*!
857 \brief Constructs bvector class
858 \param strat - operation mode strategy,
859 BM_BIT - default strategy, bvector use plain bitset
860 blocks, (performance oriented strategy).
861 BM_GAP - memory effitent strategy, bvector allocates
862 blocks as array of intervals(gaps) and convert blocks
863 into plain bitsets only when enthropy grows.
864 \param glevel_len
865 - pointer on C-style array keeping GAP block sizes.
866 bm::gap_len_table<true>::_len - default value set
867 (use bm::gap_len_table_min<true>::_len for very sparse vectors)
868 (use bm::gap_len_table_nl<true>::_len non-linear GAP growth)
869 \param bv_size
870 - bvector size (number of bits addressable by bvector), bm::id_max means
871 "no limits" (recommended).
872 bit vector allocates this space dynamically on demand.
873 \param alloc - alllocator for this instance
874
875 \sa bm::gap_len_table bm::gap_len_table_min set_new_blocks_strat
876 */
877 bvector(strategy strat = BM_BIT,
878 const gap_word_t* glevel_len = bm::gap_len_table<true>::_len,
879 size_type bv_size = bm::id_max,
880 const Alloc& alloc = Alloc())
881 : blockman_(glevel_len, bv_size, alloc),
882 new_blocks_strat_(strat),
883 size_(bv_size)
884 {}
885
886 /*!
887 \brief Constructs bvector class
888 */
889 bvector(size_type bv_size,
890 strategy strat = BM_BIT,
891 const gap_word_t* glevel_len = bm::gap_len_table<true>::_len,
892 const Alloc& alloc = Alloc())
893 : blockman_(glevel_len, bv_size, alloc),
894 new_blocks_strat_(strat),
895 size_(bv_size)
896 {}
897
898 /*!
899 \brief Copy constructor
900 */
901 bvector(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect)
902 : blockman_(bvect.blockman_),
903 new_blocks_strat_(bvect.new_blocks_strat_),
904 size_(bvect.size_)
905 {}
906
907 /*!
908 \brief Copy constructor for range copy [left..right]
909 \sa copy_range
910 */
911 bvector(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect, size_type left, size_type right)
912 : blockman_(bvect.blockman_.glevel_len_, bvect.blockman_.max_bits_, bvect.blockman_.alloc_),
913 new_blocks_strat_(bvect.new_blocks_strat_),
914 size_(bvect.size_)
915 {
916 if (!bvect.blockman_.is_init())
917 return;
918 if (left > right)
919 bm::xor_swap(left, right);
920 copy_range_no_check(bvect, left, right);
921 }
922
923 /*!
924 \brief Copy-constructor for mutable/immutable initialization
925 */
926 bvector(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect, bm::finalization is_final)
927 : blockman_(bvect.blockman_.glevel_len_, bvect.blockman_.max_bits_, bvect.blockman_.alloc_),
928 new_blocks_strat_(bvect.new_blocks_strat_),
929 size_(bvect.size_)
930 {
931 if (!bvect.blockman_.is_init())
932 return;
933 if (is_final == bm::BM_READONLY)
934 blockman_.copy_to_arena(bvect.blockman_);
935 else
936 blockman_.copy(bvect.blockman_);
937 }
938
939
940 ~bvector() BMNOEXCEPT {}
941 /*!
942 \brief Explicit post-construction initialization.
943 Must be caled to make sure safe use of *_no_check() methods
944 */
945 void init();
946
947 /*!
948 \brief Copy assignment operator
949 */
950 bvector& operator=(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect)
951 {
952 this->copy(bvect, bm::BM_UNDEFINED);
953 return *this;
954 }
955
956#ifndef BM_NO_CXX11
957 /*!
958 \brief Move constructor
959 */
960 bvector(bvector<Alloc>&& bvect) BMNOEXCEPT
961 {
962 blockman_.move_from(bvect.blockman_);
963 size_ = bvect.size_;
964 new_blocks_strat_ = bvect.new_blocks_strat_;
965 }
966
967 /*!
968 \brief Brace constructor
969 */
970 bvector(std::initializer_list<size_type> il)
971 : blockman_(bm::gap_len_table<true>::_len, bm::id_max, Alloc()),
972 new_blocks_strat_(BM_BIT),
973 size_(bm::id_max)
974 {
975 init();
976 std::initializer_list<size_type>::const_iterator it_start = il.begin();
977 std::initializer_list<size_type>::const_iterator it_end = il.end();
978 for (; it_start < it_end; ++it_start)
979 this->set_bit_no_check(*it_start);
980 }
981
982 /*!
983 \brief Move assignment operator
984 */
985 bvector& operator=(bvector<Alloc>&& bvect) BMNOEXCEPT
986 {
987 this->move_from(bvect);
988 return *this;
989 }
990#endif
991
992 /*!
993 \brief Copy bvector from the argument bvector
994 \param bvect - bit-vector to copy from
995 \param is_final - BM_READONLY - copies as immutable, BM_READWRITE - copies as mutable
996 even if the argument bvect is read-only vector,
997 BM_UNDEFINED - follow the argument type as is
998 */
999 void copy(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect, bm::finalization is_final);
1000
1001 /*!
1002 \brief Move bvector content from another bvector
1003 */
1004 void move_from(bvector<Alloc>& bvect) BMNOEXCEPT;
1005
1006 /*! \brief Exchanges content of bv and this bvector.
1007 */
1008 void swap(bvector<Alloc>& bvect) BMNOEXCEPT;
1009
1010 /*! \brief Merge/move content from another vector
1011
1012 Merge performs a logical OR operation, but the source vector
1013 is not immutable. Source content gets destroyed (memory moved)
1014 to create a union of two vectors.
1015 Merge operation can be more efficient than OR if argument is
1016 a temporary vector.
1017
1018 @param bvect - [in, out] - source vector (NOT immutable)
1019 */
1020 void merge(bm::bvector<Alloc>& bvect);
1021
1022 //@}
1023
1024 reference operator[](size_type n)
1025 {
1026 if (n >= size_)
1027 {
1028 size_type new_size = (n == bm::id_max) ? bm::id_max : n + 1;
1029 resize(new_size);
1030 }
1031 return reference(*this, n);
1032 }
1033
1034 bool operator[](size_type n) const BMNOEXCEPT
1035 {
1036 BM_ASSERT(n < size_);
1037 return get_bit(n);
1038 }
1039
1040 void operator &= (const bvector<Alloc>& bv) { bit_and(bv); }
1041 void operator ^= (const bvector<Alloc>& bv) { bit_xor(bv); }
1042 void operator |= (const bvector<Alloc>& bv) { bit_or(bv); }
1043 void operator -= (const bvector<Alloc>& bv) { bit_sub(bv); }
1044
1045 bool operator < (const bvector<Alloc>& bv) const { return compare(bv)<0; }
1046 bool operator <= (const bvector<Alloc>& bv) const { return compare(bv)<=0; }
1047 bool operator > (const bvector<Alloc>& bv) const { return compare(bv)>0; }
1048 bool operator >= (const bvector<Alloc>& bv) const { return compare(bv) >= 0; }
1049 bool operator == (const bvector<Alloc>& bv) const BMNOEXCEPT { return equal(bv); }
1050 bool operator != (const bvector<Alloc>& bv) const BMNOEXCEPT { return !equal(bv); }
1051
1052 bvector<Alloc> operator~() const { return bvector<Alloc>(*this).invert(); }
1053
1054 Alloc get_allocator() const
1055 { return blockman_.get_allocator(); }
1056
1057 /// Set allocator pool for local (non-th readed)
1058 /// memory cyclic(lots of alloc-free ops) opertations
1059 ///
1060 void set_allocator_pool(allocator_pool_type* pool_ptr) BMNOEXCEPT
1061 { blockman_.get_allocator().set_pool(pool_ptr); }
1062
1063 /// Get curent allocator pool (if set)
1064 /// @return pointer to the current pool or NULL
1065 allocator_pool_type* get_allocator_pool() BMNOEXCEPT
1066 { return blockman_.get_allocator().get_pool(); }
1067
1068 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1069 /*! @name Read-only / immutable vector methods */
1070 //@{
1071
1072 /// Turn current vector to read-only (immutable vector).
1073 /// After calling this method any modification (non-const methods) will cause undefined behavior
1074 /// (likely crash or assert)
1075 ///
1076 /// \sa is_ro
1077 void freeze();
1078
1079 /// Returns true if vector is read-only
1080 bool is_ro() const BMNOEXCEPT { return blockman_.arena_; }
1081
1082 //@}
1083
1084 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1085 /*! @name Bit access/modification methods */
1086 //@{
1087
1088 /*!
1089 \brief Sets bit n.
1090 \param n - index of the bit to be set.
1091 \param val - new bit value
1092 \return TRUE if bit was changed
1093 */
1094 bool set_bit(size_type n, bool val = true);
1095
1096 /*!
1097 \brief Sets bit n using bit AND with the provided value.
1098 \param n - index of the bit to be set.
1099 \param val - new bit value
1100 \return TRUE if bit was changed
1101 */
1102 bool set_bit_and(size_type n, bool val = true);
1103
1104 /*!
1105 \brief Increment the specified element
1106
1107 Bit increment rules:
1108 0 + 1 = 1 (no carry over)
1109 1 + 1 = 0 (with carry over returned)
1110
1111 \param n - index of the bit to be set
1112 \return TRUE if carry over created (1+1)
1113 */
1114 bool inc(size_type n);
1115
1116
1117 /*!
1118 \brief Sets bit n only if current value equals the condition
1119 \param n - index of the bit to be set.
1120 \param val - new bit value
1121 \param condition - expected current value
1122 \return TRUE if bit was changed
1123 */
1124 bool set_bit_conditional(size_type n, bool val, bool condition);
1125
1126 /*!
1127 \brief Sets bit n if val is true, clears bit n if val is false
1128 \param n - index of the bit to be set
1129 \param val - new bit value
1130 \return *this
1131 */
1132 bvector<Alloc>& set(size_type n, bool val = true);
1133
1134 /*!
1135 \brief Sets every bit in this bitset to 1.
1136 \return *this
1137 */
1138 bvector<Alloc>& set();
1139
1140 /*!
1141 \brief Set list of bits in this bitset to 1.
1142
1143 Method implements optimized bulk setting of multiple bits at once.
1144 The best results are achieved when the imput comes sorted.
1145 This is equivalent of OR (Set Union), argument set as an array.
1146
1147 @param ids - pointer on array of indexes to set
1148 @param ids_size - size of the input (ids)
1149 @param so - sort order (use BM_SORTED for faster load)
1150
1151 @sa keep, clear
1152 */
1153 void set(const size_type* ids, size_type ids_size,
1154 bm::sort_order so=bm::BM_UNKNOWN);
1155
1156 /*!
1157 \brief Keep list of bits in this bitset, others are cleared
1158
1159 This is equivalent of AND (Set Intersect), argument set as an array.
1160
1161 @param ids - pointer on array of indexes to set
1162 @param ids_size - size of the input (ids)
1163 @param so - sort order (use BM_SORTED for faster load)
1164
1165 @sa set, clear
1166 */
1167 void keep(const size_type* ids, size_type ids_size,
1168 bm::sort_order so=bm::BM_UNKNOWN);
1169
1170 /*!
1171 \brief clear list of bits in this bitset
1172
1173 This is equivalent of AND NOT (Set Substract), argument set as an array.
1174
1175 @param ids - pointer on array of indexes to set
1176 @param ids_size - size of the input (ids)
1177 @param so - sort order (use BM_SORTED for faster load)
1178
1179 @sa set, keep
1180 */
1181 void clear(const size_type* ids, size_type ids_size,
1182 bm::sort_order so=bm::BM_UNKNOWN);
1183
1184
1185 /*!
1186 \brief Set bit without checking preconditions (size, etc)
1187
1188 Fast set bit method, without safety net.
1189 Make sure you call bvector<>::init() before setting bits with this
1190 function.
1191
1192 \param n - bit number
1193 */
1194 void set_bit_no_check(size_type n);
1195
1196 /**
1197 \brief Set specified bit without checking preconditions (size, etc)
1198 */
1199 bool set_bit_no_check(size_type n, bool val);
1200
1201 /*!
1202 \brief Sets all bits in the specified closed interval [left,right]
1203 Interval must be inside the bvector's size.
1204 This method DOES NOT resize vector.
1205
1206 \param left - interval start
1207 \param right - interval end (closed interval)
1208 \param value - value to set interval in
1209
1210 \return *this
1211 @sa clear_range
1212 */
1213 bvector<Alloc>& set_range(size_type left,
1214 size_type right,
1215 bool value = true);
1216
1217
1218 /*!
1219 \brief Sets all bits to zero in the specified closed interval [left,right]
1220 Interval must be inside the bvector's size.
1221 This method DOES NOT resize vector.
1222
1223 \param left - interval start
1224 \param right - interval end (closed interval)
1225
1226 @sa set_range
1227 */
1228 void clear_range(size_type left, size_type right)
1229 { set_range(left, right, false); }
1230
1231
1232 /*!
1233 \brief Sets all bits to zero outside of the closed interval [left,right]
1234 Expected result: 00000...0[left, right]0....0000
1235
1236 \param left - interval start
1237 \param right - interval end (closed interval)
1238
1239 @sa set_range
1240 */
1241 void keep_range(size_type left, size_type right);
1242
1243 /*!
1244 \brief Copy all bits in the specified closed interval [left,right]
1245
1246 \param bvect - source bit-vector
1247 \param left - interval start
1248 \param right - interval end (closed interval)
1249 */
1250 void copy_range(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect,
1251 size_type left,
1252 size_type right);
1253
1254 /*!
1255 \brief Clears bit n.
1256 \param n - bit's index to be cleaned.
1257 \return true if bit was cleared
1258 */
1259 bool clear_bit(size_type n) { return set_bit(n, false); }
1260
1261 /*!
1262 \brief Clears bit n without precondiion checks
1263 \param n - bit's index to be cleaned.
1264 */
1265 void clear_bit_no_check(size_type n);
1266
1267 /*!
1268 \brief Clears every bit in the bitvector.
1269
1270 \param free_mem if "true" (default) bvector frees the memory,
1271 otherwise sets blocks to 0.
1272 */
1273 void clear(bool free_mem = true) BMNOEXCEPT;
1274
1275 /*!
1276 \brief Clears every bit in the bitvector.
1277 \return *this;
1278 */
1279 bvector<Alloc>& reset() BMNOEXCEPT { clear(true); return *this; }
1280
1281 /*!
1282 \brief Flips bit n
1283 \return *this
1284 */
1285 bvector<Alloc>& flip(size_type n) { this->inc(n); return *this; }
1286
1287 /*!
1288 \brief Flips all bits
1289 \return *this
1290 @sa invert
1291 */
1292 bvector<Alloc>& flip() { return invert(); }
1293
1294 //@}
1295 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1296
1297
1298 /*! Function erturns insert iterator for this bitvector */
1299 insert_iterator inserter() { return insert_iterator(*this); }
1300
1301 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1302 /*! @name Size and capacity
1303 By default bvector is dynamically sized, manual control methods
1304 available
1305 */
1306 //@{
1307
1308 /** \brief Returns bvector's capacity (number of bits it can store) */
1309 //size_type capacity() const { return blockman_.capacity(); }
1310
1311 /*! \brief return current size of the vector (bits) */
1312 size_type size() const BMNOEXCEPT { return size_; }
1313
1314 /*!
1315 \brief Change size of the bvector
1316 \param new_size - new size in bits
1317 */
1318 void resize(size_type new_size);
1319
1320 //@}
1321 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1322
1323 /*! @name Population counting, ranks, ranges and intervals
1324 */
1325 //@{
1326
1327 /*!
1328 \brief population count (count of ON bits)
1329 \sa count_range
1330 \return Total number of bits ON
1331 */
1332 size_type count() const BMNOEXCEPT;
1333
1334 /*! \brief Computes bitcount values for all bvector blocks
1335 \param arr - pointer on array of block bit counts
1336 \return Index of the last block counted.
1337 This number +1 gives you number of arr elements initialized during the
1338 function call.
1339 */
1340 block_idx_type count_blocks(unsigned* arr) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1341
1342
1343 /*!
1344 \brief Returns count of 1 bits in the given range [left..right]
1345 Uses rank-select index to accelerate the search
1346 \param left - index of first bit start counting from
1347 \param right - index of last bit
1348 \param rs_idx - block count structure to accelerate search
1349 \sa build_rs_index
1350
1351 \return population count in the diapason
1352 */
1353 size_type count_range(size_type left,
1354 size_type right,
1355 const rs_index_type& rs_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1356
1357 /*!
1358 \brief Returns count of 1 bits in the given range [left..right]
1359
1360 \param left - index of first bit start counting from
1361 \param right - index of last bit
1362
1363 \return population count in the diapason
1364 @sa count_range_no_check
1365 */
1366 size_type count_range(size_type left, size_type right) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1367
1368 /*!
1369 Returns count of 1 bits in the given range [left..right]
1370 Function expects that caller guarantees that left < right
1371
1372 @sa count_range
1373 */
1374 size_type count_range_no_check(size_type left, size_type right) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1375
1376
1377 /*!
1378 Returns count of 1 bits in the given range [left..right]
1379 Function expects that caller guarantees that left < right
1380
1381 @sa count_range
1382 */
1383 size_type count_range_no_check(size_type left,
1384 size_type right,
1385 const rs_index_type& rs_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1386
1387 /*!
1388 \brief Returns true if all bits in the range are 1s (saturated interval)
1389 Function uses closed interval [left, right]
1390
1391 \param left - index of first bit start checking
1392 \param right - index of last bit
1393
1394 \return true if all bits are 1, false otherwise
1395 @sa any_range, count_range
1396 */
1397 bool is_all_one_range(size_type left, size_type right) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1398
1399 /*!
1400 \brief Returns true if any bits in the range are 1s (non-empty interval)
1401 Function uses closed interval [left, right]
1402
1403 \param left - index of first bit start checking
1404 \param right - index of last bit
1405
1406 \return true if at least 1 bits is set
1407 @sa is_all_one_range, count_range
1408 */
1409 bool any_range(size_type left, size_type right) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1410
1411
1412 /*! \brief compute running total of all blocks in bit vector (rank-select index)
1413 \param rs_idx - [out] pointer to index / count structure
1414 \param bv_blocks - [out] list of block ids in the vector (internal, optional)
1415 Function will fill full array of running totals
1416 \sa count_to, select, find_rank
1417 */
1418 void build_rs_index(rs_index_type* rs_idx, bvector<Alloc>* bv_blocks=0) const;
1419
1420 /*!
1421 \brief Returns count of 1 bits (population) in [0..right] range.
1422
1423 This operation is also known as rank of bit N.
1424
1425 \param n - index of bit to rank
1426 \param rs_idx - rank-select to accelerate search
1427 should be prepared using build_rs_index
1428 \return population count in the range [0..n]
1429 \sa build_rs_index
1430 \sa count_to_test, select, rank, rank_corrected
1431 */
1432 size_type count_to(size_type n,
1433 const rs_index_type& rs_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1434
1435
1436 /*!
1437 \brief Returns rank of specified bit position (same as count_to())
1438
1439 \param n - index of bit to rank
1440 \param rs_idx - rank-select index
1441 \return population count in the range [0..n]
1442 \sa build_rs_index
1443 \sa count_to_test, select, rank, rank_corrected
1444 */
1445 size_type rank(size_type n,
1446 const rs_index_type& rs_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT
1447 { return count_to(n, rs_idx); }
1448
1449 /*!
1450 \brief Returns rank corrceted by the requested border value (as -1)
1451
1452 This is rank function (bit-count) minus value of bit 'n'
1453 if bit-n is true function returns rank()-1 if false returns rank()
1454 faster than rank() + test().
1455
1456
1457 \param n - index of bit to rank
1458 \param rs_idx - rank-select index
1459 \return population count in the range [0..n] corrected as -1 by the value of n
1460 \sa build_rs_index
1461 \sa count_to_test, select, rank
1462 */
1463 size_type rank_corrected(size_type n,
1464 const rs_index_type& rs_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1465
1466 /*!
1467 \brief popcount in [0..right] range if test(right) == true
1468
1469 This is conditional rank operation, which is faster than test()
1470 plus count_to()
1471
1472 \param n - index of bit to test and rank
1473 \param rs_idx - rank-select index
1474 (block count structure to accelerate search)
1475 should be prepared using build_rs_index()
1476
1477 \return population count in the diapason or 0 if right bit test failed
1478
1479 \sa build_rs_index
1480 \sa count_to
1481 */
1482 size_type
1483 count_to_test(size_type n,
1484 const rs_index_type& rs_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1485
1486
1487 /*! Recalculate bitcount (deprecated)
1488 */
1489 size_type recalc_count() BMNOEXCEPT { return count(); }
1490
1491 /*!
1492 Disables count cache. (deprecated).
1493 */
1494 void forget_count() BMNOEXCEPT {}
1495
1496 //@}
1497
1498 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1499 /*! @name Bit access (read-only) */
1500 //@{
1501
1502 /*!
1503 \brief returns true if bit n is set and false is bit n is 0.
1504 \param n - Index of the bit to check.
1505 \return Bit value (1 or 0)
1506 */
1507 bool get_bit(size_type n) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1508
1509 /*!
1510 \brief returns true if bit n is set and false is bit n is 0.
1511 \param n - Index of the bit to check.
1512 \return Bit value (1 or 0)
1513 */
1514 bool test(size_type n) const BMNOEXCEPT { return get_bit(n); }
1515
1516 //@}
1517
1518 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1519 /*! @name bit-shift and insert operations */
1520 //@{
1521
1522 /*!
1523 \brief Shift right by 1 bit, fill with zero return carry out
1524 \return Carry over bit value (1 or 0)
1525 */
1526 bool shift_right();
1527
1528 /*!
1529 \brief Shift left by 1 bit, fill with zero return carry out
1530 \return Carry over bit value (1 or 0)
1531 */
1532 bool shift_left();
1533
1534 /*!
1535 \brief Insert bit into specified position
1536 All the vector content after insert position is shifted right.
1537
1538 \param n - index of the bit to insert
1539 \param value - insert value
1540
1541 \return Carry over bit value (1 or 0)
1542 */
1543 bool insert(size_type n, bool value);
1544
1545 /*!
1546 \brief Erase bit in the specified position
1547 All the vector content after erase position is shifted left.
1548
1549 \param n - index of the bit to insert
1550 */
1551 void erase(size_type n);
1552
1553 //@}
1554
1555 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1556 /*! @name Check for empty-ness of container */
1557 //@{
1558
1559 /*!
1560 \brief Returns true if any bits in this bitset are set, and otherwise returns false.
1561 \return true if any bit is set
1562 */
1563 bool any() const BMNOEXCEPT;
1564
1565 /*!
1566 \brief Returns true if no bits are set, otherwise returns false.
1567 */
1568 bool none() const BMNOEXCEPT { return !any(); }
1569
1570 /**
1571 \brief Returns true if the set is empty (no bits are set, otherwise returns false)
1572 Please note that this is NOT a size check, it is an empty SET check (absense of 1s)
1573 */
1574 bool empty() const BMNOEXCEPT { return !any(); }
1575
1576 //@}
1577 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1578
1579 /*! @name Scan and find bits and indexes */
1580 //@{
1581
1582 /*!
1583 \fn bool bvector::find(bm::id_t& pos) const
1584 \brief Finds index of first 1 bit
1585 \param pos - [out] index of the found 1 bit
1586 \return true if search returned result
1587 \sa get_first, get_next, extract_next, find_reverse, find_first_mismatch
1588 */
1589 bool find(size_type& pos) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1590
1591 /*!
1592 \fn bool bvector::find(bm::id_t from, bm::id_t& pos) const
1593 \brief Find index of 1 bit starting from position
1594 \param from - position to start search from, please note that if bit at from position
1595 is set then it will be found, function uses closed interval [from...
1596 \param pos - [out] index of the found 1 bit
1597 \return true if search returned result
1598 \sa get_first, get_next, extract_next, find_reverse, find_first_mismatch
1599 */
1600 bool find(size_type from, size_type& pos) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1601
1602
1603 /*!
1604 \fn bm::id_t bvector::get_first() const
1605 \brief find first 1 bit in vector.
1606 Function may return 0 and this requires an extra check if bit 0 is
1607 actually set or bit-vector is empty
1608
1609 \return Index of the first 1 bit, may return 0
1610 \sa get_next, find, extract_next, find_reverse
1611 */
1612 size_type get_first() const BMNOEXCEPT { return check_or_next(0); }
1613
1614 /*!
1615 \fn bm::id_t bvector::get_next(bm::id_t prev) const
1616 \brief Finds the number of the next bit ON.
1617 \param prev - Index of the previously found bit.
1618 \return Index of the next bit which is ON or 0 if not found.
1619 \sa get_first, find, extract_next, find_reverse
1620 */
1621 size_type get_next(size_type prev) const BMNOEXCEPT
1622 { return (++prev == bm::id_max) ? 0 : check_or_next(prev); }
1623
1624 /*!
1625 \fn bm::id_t bvector::extract_next(bm::id_t prev)
1626 \brief Finds the number of the next bit ON and sets it to 0.
1627 \param prev - Index of the previously found bit.
1628 \return Index of the next bit which is ON or 0 if not found.
1629 \sa get_first, get_next, find_reverse
1630 */
1631 size_type extract_next(size_type prev)
1632 {
1633 return (++prev == bm::id_max) ? 0 : check_or_next_extract(prev);
1634 }
1635
1636 /*!
1637 \brief Finds last index of 1 bit
1638 \param pos - [out] index of the last found 1 bit
1639 \return true if search returned result
1640 \sa get_first, get_next, extract_next,
1641 \sa find, find_first_mismatch, find_range
1642 */
1643 bool find_reverse(size_type& pos) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1644
1645 /*!
1646 \brief Reverse finds next(prev) index of 1 bit
1647 \param from - index to search from
1648 \param pos - [out] found position index
1649 (undefined if method returns false)
1650 \return true if search returned result
1651 \sa get_first, get_next, extract_next,
1652 \sa find, find_first_mismatch, find_range
1653 */
1654 bool find_reverse(size_type from, size_type& pos) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1655
1656 /*!
1657 \brief Finds dynamic range of bit-vector [first, last]
1658 \param first - index of the first found 1 bit
1659 \param last - index of the last found 1 bit
1660 \return true if search returned result
1661 \sa get_first, get_next, extract_next, find, find_reverse
1662 */
1663 bool find_range(size_type& first, size_type& last) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1664
1665 /*!
1666 \brief Find bit-vector position for the specified rank(bitcount)
1667
1668 Rank based search, counts number of 1s from specified position until
1669 finds the ranked position relative to start from position.
1670 In other words: range population count between from and pos == rank.
1671
1672 \param rank - rank to find (bitcount)
1673 \param from - start positioon for rank search
1674 \param pos - position with speciefied rank (relative to from position)
1675
1676 \return true if requested rank was found
1677 */
1678 bool find_rank(size_type rank, size_type from,
1679 size_type& pos) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1680
1681 /*!
1682 \brief Find bit-vector position for the specified rank(bitcount)
1683
1684 Rank based search, counts number of 1s from specified position until
1685 finds the ranked position relative to start from position.
1686 In other words: range population count between from and pos == rank.
1687
1688 \param rank - rank to find (bitcount)
1689 \param from - start positioon for rank search
1690 \param pos - position with speciefied rank (relative to from position)
1691 \param rs_idx - rank-select index to accelarate search
1692 (should be prepared using build_rs_index)
1693
1694 \sa build_rs_index, select
1695
1696 \return true if requested rank was found
1697 */
1698 bool find_rank(size_type rank, size_type from, size_type& pos,
1699 const rs_index_type& rs_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1700
1701 /*!
1702 \brief select bit-vector position for the specified rank(bitcount)
1703
1704 Rank based search, counts number of 1s from specified position until
1705 finds the ranked position relative to start from position.
1706 Uses
1707 In other words: range population count between from and pos == rank.
1708
1709 \param rank - rank to find (bitcount)
1710 \param pos - position with speciefied rank (relative to from position) [out]
1711 \param rs_idx - block count structure to accelerate rank search
1712
1713 \sa running_count_blocks, find_rank
1714
1715 \return true if requested rank was found
1716 */
1717 bool select(size_type rank, size_type& pos,
1718 const rs_index_type& rs_idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1719
1720 //@}
1721
1722
1723 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1724 /*! @name Algebra of Sets operations */
1725 //@{
1726
1727 /*!
1728 \brief 3-operand OR : this := bv1 OR bv2
1729 \param bv1 - Argument vector 1
1730 \param bv2 - Argument vector 2
1731 \param opt_mode - optimization compression
1732 (when it is performed on the fly it is faster than a separate
1733 call to optimize()
1734 @sa optimize, bit_or
1735 */
1736 bm::bvector<Alloc>& bit_or(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv1,
1737 const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv2,
1738 typename bm::bvector<Alloc>::optmode opt_mode=opt_none);
1739
1740 /*!
1741 \brief 3-operand XOR : this := bv1 XOR bv2
1742 \param bv1 - Argument vector 1
1743 \param bv2 - Argument vector 2
1744 \param opt_mode - optimization compression
1745 (when it is performed on the fly it is faster than a separate
1746 call to optimize()
1747 @sa optimize, bit_xor
1748 */
1749 bm::bvector<Alloc>& bit_xor(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv1,
1750 const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv2,
1751 typename bm::bvector<Alloc>::optmode opt_mode=opt_none);
1752
1753 /*!
1754 \brief 3-operand AND : this := bv1 AND bv2
1755 \param bv1 - Argument vector 1
1756 \param bv2 - Argument vector 2
1757 \param opt_mode - optimization compression
1758 (when it is performed on the fly it is faster than a separate
1759 call to optimize()
1760 @sa optimize, bit_and
1761 */
1762 bm::bvector<Alloc>& bit_and(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv1,
1763 const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv2,
1764 typename bm::bvector<Alloc>::optmode opt_mode=opt_none);
1765
1766
1767 /*!
1768 \brief 3-operand AND where result is ORed into the terget vector : this |= bv1 AND bv2
1769 TARGET := TARGET OR (BV1 AND BV2)
1770
1771 \param bv1 - Argument vector 1
1772 \param bv2 - Argument vector 2
1773 \param opt_mode - optimization compression
1774 (when it is performed on the fly it is faster than a separate
1775 call to optimize()
1776 @sa optimize, bit_and
1777 */
1778 bm::bvector<Alloc>& bit_or_and(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv1,
1779 const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv2,
1780 typename bm::bvector<Alloc>::optmode opt_mode=opt_none);
1781
1782
1783 /*!
1784 \brief 3-operand SUB : this := bv1 MINUS bv2
1785 SUBtraction is also known as AND NOT
1786 \param bv1 - Argument vector 1
1787 \param bv2 - Argument vector 2
1788 \param opt_mode - optimization compression
1789 (when it is performed on the fly it is faster than a separate
1790 call to optimize()
1791 @sa optimize, bit_sub
1792 */
1793 bm::bvector<Alloc>& bit_sub(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv1,
1794 const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv2,
1795 typename bm::bvector<Alloc>::optmode opt_mode=opt_none);
1796
1797
1798 /*!
1799 \brief 2 operand logical OR
1800 \param bv - Argument vector.
1801 */
1802 bm::bvector<Alloc>& bit_or(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv)
1803 {
1804 BM_ASSERT(!is_ro());
1805 combine_operation_or(bv);
1806 return *this;
1807 }
1808
1809 /*!
1810 \brief 2 operand logical AND
1811 \param bv - argument vector
1812 \param opt_mode - set an immediate optimization
1813 */
1814 bm::bvector<Alloc>& bit_and(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv,
1815 optmode opt_mode = opt_none)
1816 {
1817 BM_ASSERT(!is_ro());
1818 combine_operation_and(bv, opt_mode);
1819 return *this;
1820 }
1821
1822 /*!
1823 \brief 2 operand logical XOR
1824 \param bv - argument vector.
1825 */
1826 bm::bvector<Alloc>& bit_xor(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv)
1827 {
1828 BM_ASSERT(!is_ro());
1829 combine_operation_xor(bv);
1830 return *this;
1831 }
1832
1833 /*!
1834 \brief 2 operand logical SUB(AND NOT). Also known as MINUS.
1835 \param bv - argument vector.
1836 */
1837 bm::bvector<Alloc>& bit_sub(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bv)
1838 {
1839 BM_ASSERT(!is_ro());
1840 combine_operation_sub(bv);
1841 return *this;
1842 }
1843
1844 /*!
1845 \brief Invert/NEG all bits
1846 It should be noted, invert is affected by size()
1847 if size is set - it only inverts [0..size-1] bits
1848 */
1849 bvector<Alloc>& invert();
1850
1851
1852 /*! \brief perform a set-algebra operation by operation code
1853 */
1854 void combine_operation(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bvect,
1855 bm::operation opcode);
1856
1857 /*! \brief perform a set-algebra operation OR
1858 */
1859 void combine_operation_or(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bvect);
1860
1861 /*! \brief perform a set-algebra operation AND
1862 */
1863 void combine_operation_and(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bvect,
1864 optmode opt_mode);
1865
1866 /*! \brief perform a set-algebra operation MINUS (AND NOT)
1867 */
1868 void combine_operation_sub(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bvect);
1869
1870 /*! \brief perform a set-algebra operation XOR
1871 */
1872 void combine_operation_xor(const bm::bvector<Alloc>& bvect);
1873
1874 // @}
1875
1876 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1877 /*! @name Iterator-traversal methods */
1878 //@{
1879
1880 /**
1881 \brief Returns enumerator pointing on the first non-zero bit.
1882 */
1883 enumerator first() const { return get_enumerator(0); }
1884
1885 /**
1886 \fn bvector::enumerator bvector::end() const
1887 \brief Returns enumerator pointing on the next bit after the last.
1888 */
1889 enumerator end() const
1890 { return typename bvector<Alloc>::enumerator(this); }
1891
1892 /**
1893 \brief Returns enumerator pointing on specified or the next available bit.
1894 */
1895 enumerator get_enumerator(size_type pos) const
1896 { return typename bvector<Alloc>::enumerator(this, pos); }
1897
1898 //@}
1899
1900 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
1901 /*! @name Memory management and compression */
1902
1903 //@{
1904
1905 /*!
1906 @brief Calculates bitvector statistics.
1907
1908 @param st - pointer on statistics structure to be filled in.
1909
1910 Function fills statistics structure containing information about how
1911 this vector uses memory and estimation of max. amount of memory
1912 bvector needs to serialize itself.
1913
1914 @sa statistics
1915 */
1916 void calc_stat(struct bm::bvector<Alloc>::statistics* st) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1917
1918
1919 /*!
1920 \brief Sets new blocks allocation strategy.
1921 \param strat - Strategy code 0 - bitblocks allocation only.
1922 1 - Blocks mutation mode (adaptive algorithm)
1923 */
1924 void set_new_blocks_strat(strategy strat) { new_blocks_strat_ = strat; }
1925
1926 /*!
1927 \brief Returns blocks allocation strategy.
1928 \return - Strategy code 0 - bitblocks allocation only.
1929 1 - Blocks mutation mode (adaptive algorithm)
1930 \sa set_new_blocks_strat
1931 */
1932 strategy get_new_blocks_strat() const BMNOEXCEPT
1933 { return new_blocks_strat_; }
1934
1935 /*!
1936 \brief Optimize memory bitvector's memory allocation.
1937
1938 Function analyze all blocks in the bitvector, compresses blocks
1939 with a regular structure, frees some memory. This function is recommended
1940 after a bulk modification of the bitvector using set_bit, clear_bit or
1941 logical operations.
1942
1943 Optionally function can calculate vector post optimization statistics
1944
1945 @param temp_block - externally allocated temp buffer for optimization
1946 BM_DECLARE_TEMP_BLOCK(tb)
1947 if NULL - it will allocated (and de-allocated upon exit)
1948 @param opt_mode - optimization level
1949 @param stat - statistics of memory consumption and serialization
1950 stat can also be computed by calc_stat() but it would require an extra pass
1951
1952 @sa optmode, optimize_gap_size, calc_stat
1953 */
1954 void optimize(bm::word_t* temp_block = 0,
1955 optmode opt_mode = opt_compress,
1956 statistics* stat = 0);
1957
1958 /*!
1959 Run partial vector optimization for the area [left..right] (specified in bit coordinates)
1960
1961 @param left - bit index to optimize from (approximate, rounded up to a nearest block)
1962 @param right - bit index to optimize to
1963 Please note that left and right define range in bit coordinates but later rounded to blocks
1964 @param temp_block - external scratch memory (MUST be pre-allocated)
1965 @param opt_mode - optimization level
1966
1967 @sa optimize
1968 */
1969 void optimize_range(
1970 size_type left, size_type right,
1971 bm::word_t* temp_block,
1972 optmode opt_mode = opt_compress);
1973
1974 /*!
1975 \brief Optimize sizes of GAP blocks
1976
1977 This method runs an analysis to find optimal GAP levels for the
1978 specific vector. Current GAP compression algorithm uses several fixed
1979 GAP sizes. By default bvector uses some reasonable preset.
1980 */
1981 void optimize_gap_size();
1982
1983 /*!
1984 @brief Sets new GAP lengths table. All GAP blocks will be reallocated
1985 to match the new scheme.
1986
1987 @param glevel_len - pointer on C-style array keeping GAP block sizes.
1988 */
1989 void set_gap_levels(const gap_word_t* glevel_len);
1990
1991 /**
1992 Return true if bvector is initialized at all
1993 @internal
1994 */
1995 bool is_init() const BMNOEXCEPT { return blockman_.is_init(); }
1996
1997 /**
1998 Calculate blocks digest vector (for diagnostics purposes)
1999 1 is added if NB is a real, allocated block
2000
2001 @param bv_blocks - [out] bvector of blocks statistics
2002 @internal
2003 */
2004 void fill_alloc_digest(bvector<Alloc>& bv_blocks) const;
2005
2006 //@}
2007
2008 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
2009
2010 /*! @name Comparison */
2011 //@{
2012
2013 /*!
2014 \brief Lexicographical comparison with a bitvector.
2015
2016 Function compares current bitvector with the provided argument
2017 bit by bit and returns -1 if this bitvector less than the argument,
2018 1 - greater, 0 - equal
2019
2020 @return 0 if this == arg, -1 if this < arg, 1 if this > arg
2021 @sa find_first_mismatch
2022 */
2023 int compare(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect) const BMNOEXCEPT;
2024
2025 /*!
2026 \brief Equal comparison with an agr bit-vector
2027 @return true if vectors are identical
2028 */
2029 bool equal(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect) const BMNOEXCEPT
2030 {
2031 size_type pos;
2032 bool found = find_first_mismatch(bvect, pos);
2033 return !found;
2034 }
2035
2036 /*!
2037 \brief Find index of first bit different between this and the agr vector
2038
2039 @param bvect - argumnet vector to compare with
2040 @param pos - [out] position of the first difference
2041 @param search_to - search limiter [0..to] to avoid overscan
2042 (default: unlimited to the vectors end)
2043
2044 @return true if didfference found, false - both vectors are equivalent
2045 @sa compare
2046 */
2047 bool find_first_mismatch(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect,
2048 size_type& pos,
2049 size_type search_to = bm::id_max
2050 ) const BMNOEXCEPT;
2051
2052 //@}
2053
2054 // --------------------------------------------------------------------
2055 /*! @name Open internals */
2056 //@{
2057
2058 /*!
2059 @internal
2060 */
2061 void combine_operation_with_block(block_idx_type nb,
2062 const bm::word_t* arg_blk,
2063 bool arg_gap,
2064 bm::operation opcode);
2065 /**
2066 \brief get access to memory manager (internal)
2067 Use only if you are BitMagic library
2068 @internal
2069 */
2070 const blocks_manager_type& get_blocks_manager() const BMNOEXCEPT
2071 { return blockman_; }
2072
2073 /**
2074 \brief get access to memory manager (internal)
2075 Use only if you are BitMagic library
2076 @internal
2077 */
2078 blocks_manager_type& get_blocks_manager() BMNOEXCEPT
2079 { return blockman_; }
2080
2081 /**
2082 Import integers (set bits). (Fast, no checks).
2083 @internal
2084 */
2085 void import(const size_type* ids, size_type ids_size,
2086 bm::sort_order sorted_idx);
2087
2088 /**
2089 Import sorted integers (set bits). (Fast, no checks).
2090 @internal
2091 */
2092 void import_sorted(const size_type* ids, const size_type ids_size);
2093
2094
2095 //@}
2096
2097 static void throw_bad_alloc();
2098
2099protected:
2100 /**
2101 Syncronize size if it got extended due to bulk import
2102 @internal
2103 */
2104 void sync_size();
2105
2106
2107 void import_block(const size_type* ids,
2108 block_idx_type nblock, size_type start, size_type stop);
2109
2110//private:
2111
2112 size_type check_or_next(size_type prev) const BMNOEXCEPT;
2113
2114 /// set bit in GAP block with GAP block length control
2115 bool gap_block_set(bm::gap_word_t* gap_blk,
2116 bool val, block_idx_type nblock, unsigned nbit);
2117
2118 /// set bit in GAP block with GAP block length control
2119 void gap_block_set_no_ret(bm::gap_word_t* gap_blk,
2120 bool val, block_idx_type nblock,
2121 unsigned nbit);
2122
2123 /// check if specified bit is 1, and set it to 0
2124 /// if specified bit is 0, scan for the next 1 and returns it
2125 /// if no 1 found returns 0
2126 size_type check_or_next_extract(size_type prev);
2127
2128
2129 /**
2130 \brief AND specified bit without checking preconditions (size, etc)
2131 */
2132 bool and_bit_no_check(size_type n, bool val);
2133
2134 bool set_bit_conditional_impl(size_type n, bool val, bool condition);
2135
2136
2137 void combine_operation_with_block(block_idx_type nb,
2138 bool gap,
2139 bm::word_t* blk,
2140 const bm::word_t* arg_blk,
2141 bool arg_gap,
2142 bm::operation opcode);
2143
2144 /**
2145 @return true if block optimization may be needed
2146 */
2147 bool combine_operation_block_or(unsigned i,
2148 unsigned j,
2149 const bm::word_t* arg_blk1,
2150 const bm::word_t* arg_blk2);
2151 bool combine_operation_block_xor(unsigned i,
2152 unsigned j,
2153 const bm::word_t* arg_blk1,
2154 const bm::word_t* arg_blk2);
2155 bool combine_operation_block_and(unsigned i,
2156 unsigned j,
2157 const bm::word_t* arg_blk1,
2158 const bm::word_t* arg_blk2);
2159
2160 bool combine_operation_block_and_or(unsigned i,
2161 unsigned j,
2162 const bm::word_t* arg_blk1,
2163 const bm::word_t* arg_blk2);
2164 bool combine_operation_block_sub(unsigned i,
2165 unsigned j,
2166 const bm::word_t* arg_blk1,
2167 const bm::word_t* arg_blk2);
2168
2169
2170 void combine_operation_block_or(unsigned i,
2171 unsigned j,
2172 bm::word_t* blk,
2173 const bm::word_t* arg_blk);
2174
2175 void combine_operation_block_xor(unsigned i,
2176 unsigned j,
2177 bm::word_t* blk,
2178 const bm::word_t* arg_blk);
2179
2180 void combine_operation_block_and(unsigned i,
2181 unsigned j,
2182 bm::word_t* blk,
2183 const bm::word_t* arg_blk);
2184
2185 void combine_operation_block_sub(unsigned i,
2186 unsigned j,
2187 bm::word_t* blk,
2188 const bm::word_t* arg_blk);
2189
2190 void copy_range_no_check(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect,
2191 size_type left,
2192 size_type right);
2193
2194private:
2195 /**
2196 \brief Set range without validity/bounds checking
2197 */
2198 void set_range_no_check(size_type left,
2199 size_type right);
2200 /**
2201 \brief Clear range without validity/bounds checking
2202 */
2203 void clear_range_no_check(size_type left,
2204 size_type right);
2205
2206 /**
2207 \brief Clear outside the range without validity/bounds checking
2208 */
2209 void keep_range_no_check(size_type left,
2210 size_type right);
2211
2212 /**
2213 Compute rank in bit-block using rank-select index
2214 */
2215 static
2216 size_type block_count_to(const bm::word_t* block,
2217 block_idx_type nb,
2218 unsigned nbit_right,
2219 const rs_index_type& rs_idx) BMNOEXCEPT;
2220 /**
2221 Compute rank in GAP block using rank-select index
2222 @param test_set - request to test nbit_right before computing count
2223 (returns 0 if not set)
2224 */
2225 static
2226 size_type gap_count_to(const bm::gap_word_t* gap_block,
2227 block_idx_type nb,
2228 unsigned nbit_right,
2229 const rs_index_type& rs_idx,
2230 bool test_set = false) BMNOEXCEPT;
2231 /**
2232 Return value of first bit in the block
2233 */
2234 bool test_first_block_bit(block_idx_type nb) const BMNOEXCEPT;
2235
2236private:
2237 blocks_manager_type blockman_; //!< bitblocks manager
2238 strategy new_blocks_strat_; //!< block allocation strategy
2239 size_type size_; //!< size in bits
2240};
2241
2242
2243//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2244
2245template<class Alloc>
2246inline bvector<Alloc> operator& (const bvector<Alloc>& bv1,
2247 const bvector<Alloc>& bv2)
2248{
2249 bvector<Alloc> ret;
2250 ret.bit_and(bv1, bv2, bvector<Alloc>::opt_none);
2251 return ret;
2252}
2253
2254//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2255
2256template<class Alloc>
2257inline bvector<Alloc> operator| (const bvector<Alloc>& bv1,
2258 const bvector<Alloc>& bv2)
2259{
2260 bvector<Alloc> ret;
2261 ret.bit_or(bv1, bv2, bvector<Alloc>::opt_none);
2262 return ret;
2263}
2264
2265//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2266
2267template<class Alloc>
2268inline bvector<Alloc> operator^ (const bvector<Alloc>& bv1,
2269 const bvector<Alloc>& bv2)
2270{
2271 bvector<Alloc> ret;
2272 ret.bit_xor(bv1, bv2, bvector<Alloc>::opt_none);
2273 return ret;
2274}
2275
2276//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2277
2278template<class Alloc>
2279inline bvector<Alloc> operator- (const bvector<Alloc>& bv1,
2280 const bvector<Alloc>& bv2)
2281{
2282 bvector<Alloc> ret;
2283 ret.bit_sub(bv1, bv2, bvector<Alloc>::opt_none);
2284 return ret;
2285}
2286
2287
2288// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2289
2290template<typename Alloc>
2291void bvector<Alloc>::init()
2292{
2293 BM_ASSERT(!is_ro());
2294 if (!blockman_.is_init())
2295 blockman_.init_tree();
2296}
2297
2298// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2299
2300template<typename Alloc>
2301void bvector<Alloc>::copy(const bvector<Alloc>& bvect, bm::finalization is_final)
2302{
2303 if (this != &bvect)
2304 {
2305 blockman_.deinit_tree();
2306 switch (is_final)
2307 {
2308 case bm::BM_UNDEFINED:
2309 if (bvect.is_ro())
2310 {
2311 blockman_.copy_to_arena(bvect.blockman_);
2312 size_ = bvect.size();
2313 }
2314 else
2315 {
2316 blockman_.copy(bvect.blockman_);
2317 resize(bvect.size());
2318 }
2319 break;
2320 case bm::BM_READONLY:
2321 blockman_.copy_to_arena(bvect.blockman_);
2322 size_ = bvect.size();
2323 break;
2324 case bm::BM_READWRITE:
2325 blockman_.copy(bvect.blockman_);
2326 resize(bvect.size());
2327 break;
2328 default:
2329 BM_ASSERT(0);
2330 break;
2331 } // switch
2332 }
2333}
2334
2335// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2336
2337template<typename Alloc>
2338void bvector<Alloc>::move_from(bvector<Alloc>& bvect) BMNOEXCEPT
2339{
2340 if (this != &bvect)
2341 {
2342 blockman_.move_from(bvect.blockman_);
2343 size_ = bvect.size_;
2344 new_blocks_strat_ = bvect.new_blocks_strat_;
2345 }
2346}
2347
2348//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2349
2350template<class Alloc>
2351void bvector<Alloc>::keep_range(size_type left, size_type right)
2352{
2353 BM_ASSERT(!is_ro());
2354 if (!blockman_.is_init())
2355 return; // nothing to do
2356
2357 if (right < left)
2358 bm::xor_swap(left, right);
2359
2360 keep_range_no_check(left, right);
2361}
2362
2363// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2364
2365template<typename Alloc>
2366bvector<Alloc>& bvector<Alloc>::set_range(size_type left,
2367 size_type right,
2368 bool value)
2369{
2370 BM_ASSERT(!is_ro());
2371
2372 if (!blockman_.is_init() && !value)
2373 return *this; // nothing to do
2374
2375 if (right < left)
2376 return set_range(right, left, value);
2377
2378 BM_ASSERT_THROW(right < bm::id_max, BM_ERR_RANGE);
2379 if (right >= size_) // this vect shorter than the arg.
2380 {
2381 size_type new_size = (right == bm::id_max) ? bm::id_max : right + 1;
2382 resize(new_size);
2383 }
2384
2385 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
2386 BM_ASSERT(left < size_);
2387
2388 if (value)
2389 set_range_no_check(left, right);
2390 else
2391 clear_range_no_check(left, right);
2392
2393 return *this;
2394}
2395
2396// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2397
2398template<typename Alloc>
2399typename bvector<Alloc>::size_type bvector<Alloc>::count() const BMNOEXCEPT
2400{
2401 if (!blockman_.is_init())
2402 return 0;
2403
2404 word_t*** blk_root = blockman_.top_blocks_root();
2405 BM_ASSERT(blk_root);
2406
2407 size_type cnt = 0;
2408 unsigned top_blocks = blockman_.top_block_size();
2409 for (unsigned i = 0; i < top_blocks; ++i)
2410 {
2411 bm::word_t** blk_blk = blk_root[i];
2412 if (!blk_blk)
2413 {
2414 ++i;
2415 bool found = bm::find_not_null_ptr(blk_root, i, top_blocks, &i);
2416 if (!found)
2417 break;
2418 blk_blk = blk_root[i];
2419 BM_ASSERT(blk_blk);
2420 if (!blk_blk)
2421 break;
2422 }
2423 if ((bm::word_t*)blk_blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
2424 {
2425 cnt += bm::gap_max_bits * bm::set_sub_array_size;
2426 continue;
2427 }
2428 unsigned j = 0;
2429 do
2430 {
2431 if (blk_blk[j])
2432 cnt += blockman_.block_bitcount(blk_blk[j]);
2433 if (blk_blk[j+1])
2434 cnt += blockman_.block_bitcount(blk_blk[j+1]);
2435 if (blk_blk[j+2])
2436 cnt += blockman_.block_bitcount(blk_blk[j+2]);
2437 if (blk_blk[j+3])
2438 cnt += blockman_.block_bitcount(blk_blk[j+3]);
2439 j += 4;
2440 } while (j < bm::set_sub_array_size);
2441
2442 } // for i
2443 return cnt;
2444}
2445
2446// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2447
2448template<typename Alloc>
2449bool bvector<Alloc>::any() const BMNOEXCEPT
2450{
2451 word_t*** blk_root = blockman_.top_blocks_root();
2452 if (!blk_root)
2453 return false;
2454 typename blocks_manager_type::block_any_func func(blockman_);
2455 return for_each_nzblock_if(blk_root, blockman_.top_block_size(), func);
2456}
2457
2458// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2459
2460template<typename Alloc>
2461void bvector<Alloc>::resize(size_type new_size)
2462{
2463 BM_ASSERT(!is_ro());
2464
2465 if (size_ == new_size) return; // nothing to do
2466 if (size_ < new_size) // size grows
2467 {
2468 if (!blockman_.is_init())
2469 blockman_.init_tree();
2470
2471 blockman_.reserve(new_size);
2472 size_ = new_size;
2473 }
2474 else // shrink
2475 {
2476 set_range(new_size, size_ - 1, false); // clear the tail
2477 size_ = new_size;
2478 }
2479}
2480
2481// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2482
2483template<typename Alloc>
2484void bvector<Alloc>::sync_size()
2485{
2486 BM_ASSERT(!is_ro());
2487
2488 if (size_ >= bm::id_max)
2489 return;
2490 bvector<Alloc>::size_type last;
2491 bool found = find_reverse(last);
2492 if (found && last >= size_)
2493 resize(last+1);
2494}
2495
2496// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2497
2498template<typename Alloc>
2499void bvector<Alloc>::build_rs_index(rs_index_type* rs_idx,
2500 bvector<Alloc>* bv_blocks) const
2501{
2502 BM_ASSERT(rs_idx);
2503 if (bv_blocks)
2504 {
2505 bv_blocks->clear();
2506 bv_blocks->init();
2507 }
2508
2509 unsigned bcount[bm::set_sub_array_size];
2510 bm::id64_t sub_count[bm::set_sub_array_size];
2511
2512 rs_idx->init();
2513 if (!blockman_.is_init())
2514 return;
2515
2516 // resize the RS index to fit the vector
2517 //
2518 size_type last_bit;
2519 bool found = find_reverse(last_bit);
2520 if (!found)
2521 return;
2522 block_idx_type nb = (last_bit >> bm::set_block_shift);
2523 unsigned i0, j0;
2524 bm::get_block_coord(nb, i0, j0);
2525
2526 unsigned real_top_blocks = blockman_.find_real_top_blocks();
2527 unsigned max_top_blocks = blockman_.find_max_top_blocks();
2528 if (nb < (max_top_blocks * bm::set_sub_array_size))
2529 nb = (max_top_blocks * bm::set_sub_array_size);
2530 rs_idx->set_total(nb + 1);
2531 rs_idx->resize(nb + 1);
2532 rs_idx->resize_effective_super_blocks(real_top_blocks);
2533
2534 // index construction
2535 //
2536 BM_ASSERT(max_top_blocks <= blockman_.top_block_size());
2537 bm::word_t*** blk_root = blockman_.top_blocks_root();
2538 for (unsigned i = 0; i < max_top_blocks; ++i)
2539 {
2540 bm::word_t** blk_blk = blk_root[i];
2541 if (!blk_blk)
2542 {
2543 rs_idx->set_null_super_block(i);
2544 continue;
2545 }
2546 if ((bm::word_t*)blk_blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
2547 {
2548 rs_idx->set_full_super_block(i);
2549 if (bv_blocks)
2550 {
2551 size_type nb_from = i * bm::set_sub_array_size;
2552 size_type nb_to = nb_from + bm::set_sub_array_size - 1;
2553 bv_blocks->set_range_no_check(nb_from, nb_to);
2554 }
2555 continue;
2556 }
2557
2558 unsigned j = 0;
2559 do
2560 {
2561 const bm::word_t* block = blk_blk[j];
2562 if (!block)
2563 {
2564 bcount[j] = 0; sub_count[j] = 0;
2565 continue;
2566 }
2567 unsigned local_first, local_second, local_third;
2568 bm::id64_t aux0, aux1; // aux infomation to encode
2569 if (BM_IS_GAP(block))
2570 {
2571 const bm::gap_word_t* const gap_block = BMGAP_PTR(block);
2572 local_first =
2573 bm::gap_bit_count_to(gap_block, (gap_word_t)bm::rs3_border0);
2574 local_second =
2575 bm::gap_bit_count_range(gap_block,
2576 bm::gap_word_t(bm::rs3_border0+1),
2577 bm::rs3_border1);
2578 local_third =
2579 bm::gap_bit_count_range(gap_block,
2580 bm::gap_word_t(bm::rs3_border1+1),
2581 bm::gap_word_t(bm::gap_max_bits-1));
2582
2583 // for GAP block calculate borderline positions in GAP
2584 // and value (0|1), save to AUX
2585 //
2586 unsigned is_set;
2587 aux0 = bm::gap_bfind(gap_block, rs3_border0+1, &is_set);
2588 aux0 <<= 1;
2589 if (is_set) aux0 |= 1;
2590 aux1 = bm::gap_bfind(gap_block, rs3_border1+1, &is_set);
2591 aux1 <<= 1;
2592 if (is_set) aux1 |= 1;
2593 }
2594 else
2595 {
2596 block = BLOCK_ADDR_SAN(block); // TODO: optimize FULL
2597 local_first =
2598 bm::bit_block_calc_count_to(block, bm::rs3_border0);
2599 local_second =
2600 bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block,
2601 bm::rs3_border0+1,
2602 bm::rs3_border1);
2603 local_third =
2604 bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block,
2605 bm::rs3_border1+1,
2606 bm::gap_max_bits-1);
2607 // compute inetrmediate points
2608 aux0 = bm::bit_block_calc_count_to(block, bm::rs3_border0_1);
2609 aux1 = bm::bit_block_calc_count_to(block, bm::rs3_border1_1);
2610 }
2611 unsigned cnt = local_first + local_second + local_third;
2612 BM_ASSERT(cnt == blockman_.block_bitcount(block));
2613
2614 bcount[j] = cnt;
2615 if (bv_blocks && cnt)
2616 bv_blocks->set_bit_no_check(i * bm::set_sub_array_size + j);
2617
2618 BM_ASSERT(cnt >= local_first + local_second);
2619 sub_count[j] = bm::id64_t(local_first | (local_second << 16)) |
2620 (aux0 << 32) | (aux1 << 48);
2621
2622 } while (++j < bm::set_sub_array_size);
2623
2624 rs_idx->register_super_block(i, &bcount[0], &sub_count[0]);
2625
2626 } // for i
2627
2628}
2629
2630
2631// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2632
2633template<typename Alloc>
2634typename bvector<Alloc>::block_idx_type
2635bvector<Alloc>::count_blocks(unsigned* arr) const BMNOEXCEPT
2636{
2637 bm::word_t*** blk_root = blockman_.top_blocks_root();
2638 if (blk_root == 0)
2639 return 0;
2640 typename blocks_manager_type::block_count_arr_func func(blockman_, &(arr[0]));
2641 bm::for_each_nzblock(blk_root, blockman_.top_block_size(), func);
2642 return func.last_block();
2643}
2644
2645// -----------------------------------------------------------------------
2646
2647#define BM_BORDER_TEST(blk, idx) bool(blk[idx >> bm::set_word_shift] & (1u << (idx & bm::set_word_mask)))
2648
2649
2650#if (defined(BMSSE42OPT) || defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined(BMAVX512OPT) || \
2651 defined(BMWASMSIMDOPT) || defined(BMNEONOPT))
2652
2653
2654template<typename Alloc>
2655typename bvector<Alloc>::size_type
2656bvector<Alloc>::block_count_to(const bm::word_t* block,
2657 block_idx_type nb,
2658 unsigned nbit_right,
2659 const rs_index_type& rs_idx) BMNOEXCEPT
2660{
2661 BM_ASSERT(IS_VALID_ADDR(block));
2662 size_type c;
2663
2664 bm::id64_t sub = rs_idx.sub_count(nb);
2665 unsigned sub_cnt = unsigned(sub);
2666 unsigned first = sub_cnt & 0xFFFF;
2667 unsigned second = sub_cnt >> 16;
2668
2669 BM_ASSERT(first == bm::bit_block_calc_count_to(block, rs3_border0));
2670 BM_ASSERT(second == bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block, rs3_border0+1, rs3_border1));
2671
2672
2673 {
2674 unsigned cnt, aux0(bm::gap_word_t(sub >> 32)); (void)cnt; (void)aux0;
2675 BM_ASSERT(aux0 == (cnt =bm::bit_block_calc_count_to(block, bm::rs3_border0_1)));
2676 unsigned cnt1, aux1(bm::gap_word_t(sub >> 48)); (void)aux1; (void) cnt1;
2677 BM_ASSERT(aux1 == (cnt1 =bm::bit_block_calc_count_to(block, bm::rs3_border1_1)));
2678 }
2679
2680
2681 #if defined(BM64_SSE4) || defined(BM64_AVX2) || defined(BM64_AVX512)
2682 const unsigned cutoff_bias = rs3_half_span/8;
2683 #else
2684 const unsigned cutoff_bias = 0;
2685 #endif
2686
2687 unsigned sub_range = rs_idx.find_sub_range(nbit_right);
2688
2689 // evaluate 3 sub-block intervals (and sub-intervals)
2690 // |--------[0]-----*-----[1]----*-----|
2691 switch(sub_range) // sub-range rank calc
2692 {
2693 case 0:
2694 // |--x-----[0]-----------[1]----------|
2695 if (nbit_right <= rs3_border0/2 + cutoff_bias)
2696 {
2697 c = bm::bit_block_calc_count_range<true, false>(block, 0, nbit_right);
2698 }
2699 else
2700 {
2701 // |--------[x]-----------[1]----------|
2702 if (nbit_right == rs3_border0)
2703 {
2704 c = first;
2705 }
2706 else
2707 {
2708 // |------x-[0]-----------[1]----------|
2709 c = bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block, nbit_right+1,
2710 rs3_border0);
2711 c = first - c;
2712 }
2713 }
2714 break;
2715 case 1:
2716 {
2717 // |--------[0]-x---------[1]----------|
2718 if (nbit_right <= rs3_border0_1 + cutoff_bias)
2719 {
2720 c =
2721 bm::bit_block_calc_count_range<true, false>(block,
2722 bm::rs3_border0,
2723 nbit_right);
2724 c += first - BM_BORDER_TEST(block, bm::rs3_border0);
2725 }
2726 else
2727 {
2728 unsigned bc_second_range = first + second;
2729 // |--------[0]-----------[x]----------|
2730 if (nbit_right == rs3_border1)
2731 {
2732 c = bc_second_range;
2733 }
2734 else // sub-range processing
2735 {
2736 // |--------[0]--------x--[1]----------|
2737 BM_ASSERT(nbit_right > bm::rs3_border0_1);
2738 unsigned d1 = nbit_right - bm::rs3_border0_1;
2739 unsigned d2 = rs3_border1 - nbit_right;
2740 if (d2 < d1)
2741 {
2742 // |--------[0]----|----x-[1]----------|
2743 c = bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block,
2744 nbit_right+1,
2745 rs3_border1);
2746 c = bc_second_range - c;
2747 }
2748 else
2749 {
2750 // |--------[0]----|-x----[1]----------|
2751 c = bm::bit_block_calc_count_range<true, false>(
2752 block,
2753 bm::rs3_border0_1,
2754 nbit_right);
2755 unsigned aux0 = bm::gap_word_t(sub >> 32);
2756 c += aux0;
